other_tests.changes_over_time: Confirmed total villous atrophy on repeat biopsy at 4 years of age.
Diarrhea resolved with treatment before the biopsy, normal bowel function and weight gain maintained since starting oral cyclosporine.

other_tests.findings: focal spongiotic dermatitis with subcorneal vesiculo-pustule formation consistent with eczema
other_tests.changes_over_time: Transitioned to a diagnosis of bullous pemphigoid with a repeat biopsy at 7 years of age.

other_tests.findings: subepidermal blister compatible with bullous pemphigoid
other_tests.changes_over_time: Intravenous immunoglobulin and dapsone were added to the treatment regimen, leading to gradual resolution of the bullae.

other_tests.findings: central ulceration with fibrin deposition, adjacent pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia, a mixed inflammatory infiltrate, and numerous eosinophils
other_tests.changes_over_time: Lesional direct immunofluorescence demonstrated linear staining at the dermal-epidermal junction confirming pemphigoid nodularis, treated with rituximab resulting in marked improvement.
